gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਮਧੁ ਮਾਖੀ ਸੀਚਿ ਸੀਚਿ ਕੈ ੲਿਕਤ੍ਰ ਕਰੈ ਹਰੈ ਮਧੂ ਅਾੲਿਤਾ ਕੇ ਮੁਖਿ ਛਾਰੁ ਡਾਰਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Madhu Maakhee Seechi Seechi Kai Ikatr Karai , Harai Madhoo Aaitaa Kay Moukhi Chhaaru Daari Kai ?
translation: Just as honey bee hops from flower to flower and collects honey, but a honey collector smokes the bees away, and takes the honey.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਬਛ ਹੇਤ ਗੳੂ ਸੰਚਤ ਹੈ ਖੀਰ ਤਾਹਿ ਲੇਤ ਹੈ ਅਹੀਰੁ ਦੁਹਿ ਬਛਰੇ ਬਿਡਾਰਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Bachh Hayt Gaoo Sanchat Hai Kheera , Taahi Layt Hai Aheeru Duhi Bachharay Bidaari Kai ?
translation: Just as a cow collects milk in her teats for the calf, but a milkman uses the calf to bring down her milk. He ties the calf away, milks the cow and takes it away.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਧਰ ਖੋਦਿ ਖੋਦਿ ਕਰਿ ਬਿਲ ਸਾਜੈ ਮੂਸਾ ਪੈਸਤ ਸਰਪੁ ਧਾੲਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਤਾਹਿ ਮਾਰਿ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Dhar Khodi Khodi Kari Bil Saajai Moosaa , Paisat Sarapu Dhaai Khaai Taahi Maari Kai ?
translation: Just as a rodent digs up earth to make a burrow but a snake enters the burrow and eats away the rodent.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਕੋਟਿ ਪਾਪ ਕਰਿ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਜੋਰਿ ਜੋਰਿ ਮੂੜ ਅੰਤਿ ਕਾਲਿ ਛਾਡਿ ਚਲੈ ਦੋਨੋ ਕਰ ਝਾਰਿ ਕੈ ॥੫੫੫॥
transliteration: Taisay Koti Paap Kari Maaiaa Jori Jori Moorha , Anti Kaali Chhaadi Chalai Dono Kar Jhaari Kai ?555?
translation: Similarly an ignorant and foolish person indulges in umpteen sins, collects wealth and leaves this world empty-handed. (All his earnings and material goods prove worthless ultimately).  (555)
